data.event: Harrisburg, and all of Banner County, were originally part of Cheyenne County and began with a homestead in 1884.
In November, 1888, Cheyenne County subdivided into five counties, and the settlement was included in the territory which became Banner County.
However, in 1889 Charles Schooley, a settler, donated part of his land for the development of a formal town.
In 1951, oil (which had first been discovered in 1919) became the county's third commodity.
